title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: ‘Fallout’ Producer Jonathan Nolan on AI: ‘We’re in Such a Frothy Moment’
items.description: The Westworld showrunner thinks AI will be good for burgeoning filmmakers, but not for Hollywood blockbusters.

items.title: ‘She Has a Presence’: The ‘Melania’ Superfans Who Turned Up for Opening Weekend
items.description: WIRED attended two documentary screening parties—one on each coast—for the First Lady’s film. What a time.

items.title: 12 Athletes to Watch at the 2026 Winter Olympics
items.description: History is already being made at the Milano Cortina Games—and they haven’t even started.

items.title: Avalanche thinks the fusion power industry should think smaller
items.description: Avalanche has raised $29 million in fresh funding to pursue its unique approach to fusion power, which can currently fit on a table.

items.title: Fintech CEO and Forbes 30 Under 30 alum has been charged for alleged fraud
items.description: The startup CEO says she plans to publicly address the charges this week.

items.title: All the Sports You Won’t See at the 2026 Winter Olympics
items.description: The makeup of the Winter Olympics has changed many times in the 100-plus years of the Games. Here are some sports that haven’t stood the test of time.

items.title: Nick Goepper’s Starter Pack: Winter Olympics 2026
items.description: What a three-time Olympic medalist packs for the Milano Cortina Winter Games.

items.title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX officially acquires Elon Musk’s xAI, with plan to build data centers in space

items.title: Waymo raises $16B to scale robotaxi fleet internationally
items.description: Waymo said the funds will be used to fuel its growth, which has accelerated over the past year and doesn't appear to be slowing.
